bugs_detected.probable_cause: The button likely scrolls to a section on the landing page or has no implemented action for an actual demo video

missing_features: Interactive demo on landing page (embeddable card swipe preview)
Guest/anonymous trial mode with limited cards
Demo video showing the app in action
Credibility markers for statistics (research citations, user testimonials, user count)

emotional_timeline.first_impression: Impressed by visual design — 'this looks cool'
emotional_timeline.mid_experience: Curious but unwilling to commit to account creation
frustration_points: No way to try the app without signing up
emotional_timeline.final_emotional_state: Interested but bounced — the signup barrier prevented conversion

recurring_issues.issue: Post-registration redirect to landing page instead of dashboard
recurring_issues.description: After successful registration, users are redirected to the marketing landing page (/) instead of /cards/learning. This causes immediate confusion and disorientation for every new user. The bug is in register/page.tsx where router.push('/') is called instead of router.push('/cards/learning').

recurring_issues.issue: AI daily generation limit of 3 is too restrictive
recurring_issues.description: Free users can only generate 3 AI-assisted cards per day. For users trying to build a vocabulary deck (SAT, GRE, IELTS), this makes the app impractical. Users hit the limit within 5 minutes of their first session, immediately encountering a paywall during their most engaged moment.

recurring_issues.issue: No language switcher on landing/auth pages
recurring_issues.description: Arabic speakers must create an account and navigate to Settings to discover the app supports Arabic. The language switcher is only available in /settings, not on the landing page, login, or register pages. This causes Arabic-speaking users to bounce before ever discovering the bilingual support.

recurring_issues.issue: AI sentence tone is hardcoded to dramatic/disturbing — no customization
recurring_issues.description: The Groq AI prompt explicitly instructs: 'Every sentence MUST be emotionally intense, shocking, or dramatic (e.g., sheer panic, heartbreak, fear, pain, extreme danger)'. This is inappropriate for children, professional/medical study, beginners, and business contexts. No tone selection or content filter exists.

recurring_issues.issue: No demo, preview, or guest mode before registration
recurring_issues.description: All app features require authentication through NextAuth middleware. Casual visitors cannot experience the core product (card creation, swipe review) without creating an account. This creates an unnecessary conversion barrier. The 'Watch Demo' button doesn't link to an actual demo.

strongest_features.description: The Groq AI integration that generates contextual sentences for vocabulary words is consistently praised as the app's most unique and valuable feature. It saves significant time and produces high-quality, memorable contexts.
The Tinder-style swipe interface for reviewing flashcards is universally intuitive, engaging, and satisfying. The framer-motion animations make it feel premium and native-quality.

strongest_features.feature: Dark theme and visual design quality
strongest_features.description: The premium dark theme with consistent design system, custom SVG animations, and attention to visual detail makes the app feel high-quality and modern. Users consistently note it looks premium.
The comprehensive Arabic language support with proper RTL layout transformation is rare among language learning apps and extremely well-implemented.
The combination of SM-2 algorithm scheduling with XP rewards, streaks, and a leaderboard creates an effective motivation system that encourages daily engagement.

global_analysis.most_confusing_flow: Post-registration redirect to landing page. Users register, expect to enter the app, and instead see the marketing page again. Combined with the landing page being entirely different from the authenticated dashboard, users don't know where they are or what happened.
global_analysis.biggest_onboarding_weakness: No guided tutorial or interactive walkthrough after account creation. Users land on a welcome screen with text instructions but never see an actual demo of the card creation → AI generation → swipe review workflow. The AI blur-trigger mechanism is particularly non-obvious without explicit guidance.
global_analysis.highest_dropoff_point: The moment after registration (redirect to landing page) and the AI daily limit wall (hit within 5 minutes). These two points cause the most user abandonments — the first from confusion, the second from frustration when the most valuable feature is gated.
trust_risk_points: Landing page statistics ('98% Retention Rate', '3x Faster Learning') have no sources, citations, or methodology — they appear fabricated
'Watch Demo' button doesn't deliver an actual demo — feels deceptive
'Start Free Trial' label implies a trial period but no trial mechanics exist — it's just a freemium signup
No visible privacy policy or terms acceptance during registration flow
No email verification — accounts can be created with any email address
Subscription has no visible cancellation/management UI — users may feel trapped
AI-generated content has no safety filters — inappropriate content for minors is possible
performance_risk_points: Landing page loads a large JS bundle with framer-motion animations — 8+ seconds on slow 3G connections
No code splitting or lazy loading visible for the landing page SVG components (2365 lines in page.tsx)
In-memory rate limiting resets on server restart and doesn't work across multiple Vercel serverless instances
Audio pre-fetch fires for 5 cards simultaneously — can overwhelm slow connections
No image optimization or responsive srcset — full Unsplash images loaded regardless of device
CockroachDB queries in dash endpoint run sequentially (4 separate queries) instead of parallel
The layout.tsx renders Google Ads script for all users including Pro subscribers

critical.title: Fix post-registration redirect
critical.description: Change router.push('/') to router.push('/cards/learning') in register/page.tsx. Every new user currently hits this bug.
critical.impact: Fixes the first impression for 100% of new users

critical.title: Add AI content tone selection or safety filter
critical.description: The AI prompt's requirement for 'shocking', 'panic', and 'extreme danger' scenarios makes the app unsuitable for children, parents, professional users, and beginners. Add at minimum a toggle for academic/gentle/dramatic tone. This is also a potential content liability issue.
critical.impact: Removes a deal-breaker for 40% of potential users (families, professionals, ESL beginners)

critical.title: Fix header logo empty href
critical.description: The Flotter logo in the header has href='' — change to href='/' or href='/cards/learning' depending on auth state.
critical.impact: Fixes broken navigation and brand click behavior

high_impact.title: Add language switcher to landing page and auth pages
high_impact.description: Expose the LanguageProvider's language toggle on the landing page, login page, and register page. Arabic-speaking users currently bounce because they can't discover the Arabic support without creating an account first.
high_impact.impact: Prevents bounce for Arabic-speaking visitors — potentially large market segment

high_impact.title: Increase free AI generation limit to 5-10 per day
high_impact.description: 3 generations is hit within the first 5 minutes. Increasing to 5-10 would let users experience the AI value proposition long enough to build a meaningful deck and consider upgrading.
high_impact.impact: Significantly improves first-session experience and conversion likelihood

high_impact.title: Add interactive demo or guest preview on landing page
high_impact.description: Create a demo card component on the landing page that lets visitors experience the swipe mechanic without registration. This would dramatically reduce bounce rate for casual visitors.
high_impact.impact: Reduces signup wall friction — could improve conversion by 20-40%

high_impact.title: Add no-signup-needed subscription cancellation/management UI
high_impact.description: Users who subscribe have no visible way to cancel or manage their subscription within the app. Add a link to Polar's customer portal or build a management page.
high_impact.impact: Legal/trust obligation — reduces support burden and potential chargebacks

high_impact.title: Reduce Pro upsell modal frequency
high_impact.description: Showing upsell every 10 swipes is too aggressive. Change to once per session or once per day. The current frequency disrupts the learning flow and creates negative sentiment.
high_impact.impact: Improves review session flow and user satisfaction

medium.title: Add password strength indicator to registration form
medium.description: Show inline validation with checkmarks for each password requirement (8+ chars, uppercase, lowercase, number) as the user types instead of revealing rules only on form submission failure.
medium.impact: Eliminates registration friction for all new credential users

medium.title: Add PWA support with install prompt and basic offline mode
medium.description: Add a service worker that caches card data for offline review. Add 'Add to Home Screen' prompt. This enables subway commuters and users with unreliable connections.
medium.impact: Opens the app to users with connectivity constraints

medium.title: Add bulk card creation / CSV import
medium.description: Let users paste a list of words or upload a CSV to create multiple cards at once. Run AI generation in batch. Critical for SAT/GRE/IELTS prep users who need 100+ cards.
medium.impact: Makes the app viable for serious academic users

medium.title: Add deck/folder organization for cards
medium.description: Allow users to group cards into decks (SAT Vocab, Business English, etc.) with separate statistics per deck.
medium.impact: Enables organized study for users with multiple learning goals

medium.title: Add review reminder notifications
medium.description: Implement web push notifications or at minimum email reminders for due reviews. Users forget to return without external prompts.
medium.impact: Significantly improves daily active user retention

medium.title: Add tap-to-review buttons alongside swipe
medium.description: Show 'Learned' and 'Review Again' buttons below the flashcard as an alternative to swiping. Essential for accessibility and older users unfamiliar with swipe gestures.
medium.impact: Makes the app accessible to non-tech-savvy users

medium.title: Optimize landing page performance
medium.description: The landing page is 2365 lines of client-side React with heavy framer-motion animations. Implement code splitting, lazy loading for below-fold sections, and reduce the initial JS bundle. Critical for slow-connection users.
medium.impact: Reduces bounce rate for slow-connection users (significant in developing markets)

medium.title: Add streak grace period or free recovery option
medium.description: Instead of resetting streak on a single missed day, give users a 2-day grace period or let them recover the streak once per month via watching an ad or completing extra reviews.
medium.impact: Reduces demotivation and user churn from punitive streak mechanics

low.title: Fix static 'Recently added' label in card search
low.description: All cards show 'Recently added' regardless of actual creation date. Show actual creation date or last review date instead.
low.impact: Small UX improvement for card management

low.title: Add font size / accessibility settings
low.description: Allow users to adjust text size or choose from small/medium/large presets. Current base font sizes (11px labels, 14px body) are small for older users.
low.impact: Improves accessibility for older and visually impaired users

low.title: Replace placeholder ad IDs with real values or hide the banner
low.description: The AdBanner component uses 'ca-pub-XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX' — either add real AdSense IDs or conditionally render the component only when valid IDs are configured.
low.impact: Removes wasted screen space and broken ad impression

low.title: Add email verification after registration
low.description: Currently, any email address can be used without verification. Add email verification flow to prevent abuse and enable password recovery.
low.impact: Improves security and enables future features like password reset

low.title: Add 'Forgot Password' link on login page
low.description: No password recovery flow exists. Users who forget their password have no recovery path.
low.impact: Prevents user lockout and reduces support burden

low.title: Conditionally load Google Ads script only for non-Pro users
low.description: The AdSense script loads in layout.tsx for all users including Pro subscribers who should be ad-free. Add conditional rendering based on session/subscription status.
low.impact: Small performance improvement and cleaner experience for Pro users
